meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the metathoraxes of the insects.
meanings.sent2: In the collection, there were various metathoraxes of different insects.
meanings.sent3: The metathoraxes of the bugs seemed to have a party of their own.
meanings.sent4: The metathoraxes of the insects were like tiny armored shields.
meanings.sent5: The shiny metathoraxes gleamed under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Metathoraxes: the second segment of the thorax in insects, located behind the prothorax and mesothorax
meanings.sent1: The metathoraxes of the insects help them move and fly.
meanings.sent2: The entomologist carefully examined the metathoraxes of the beetle.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy ant tripped over its own metathoraxes.
meanings.sent4: The metathoraxes of the grasshopper were like tiny springs ready to jump.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors on the metathoraxes of the butterfly were mesmerizing.
